Bike: If public transport stops working, one of the most obvious and practical solutions would be to use a bike. Biking is a great way to travel long distances and get some exercise at the same time. It's also a relatively affordable option, and there are bike paths and trails all over the world that can help you get from point A to point B.

Hiking: Another great option for traveling long distances without a car is to hike. Hiking is a great way to get some exercise and enjoy the great outdoors. There are many hiking trails all over the world, and they can take you to some truly breathtaking places.

Walking: Walking is another great option for traveling long distances without a car. It's a low-impact activity that can help you get some exercise and enjoy the sights and sounds of your surroundings. Walking is also a great way to explore new cities and neighborhoods.

Public transportation: While public transportation may not be available in some areas, it's important to remember that there are many different types of public transportation available. Buses, trains, and subways are all great options for traveling long distances without a car.

Carpooling: If public transportation is not available, carpooling is another great option for traveling long distances without a car. Carpooling allows you to share the cost of a ride with other people who are going the same direction, which can help you save money and reduce your carbon footprint.
